alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 12:36AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Brown and western Bartholomew Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1236 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Franklin to 9 miles south of Nashville. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Brown and western Bartholomew Counties, including the following locations... Spurgeons Corner, Waymansville, Elkinsville, Clifford, Stone Head, Gnaw Bone, Story, Taylorsville and Edinburgh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for central and south central Indiana.
